svg.content: <mxfile host="www.draw.io" modified="2019-09-26T09:30:58.430Z" agent="Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_14_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/76.0.3809.132 Safari/537.36" etag="sRjQSjaa6Nej2RI7GyAz" version="11.3.1" type="github" pages="1"><diagram id="vDubVXyBe1HbTso4zLXK" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 321px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div: Component gets rendered onto the screen

switch.text: Component gets rendered onto the screen

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 22px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 332px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 481px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div:
Component's 'componentDidMount' lifecycle method gets called
(we need class-based components)

switch.text:
Component's 'componentDidMount' lifecycle method gets called
(we need class-based components)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 371px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 367px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div:
Action creator runs code to make an API request
(using axios for example)

switch.text:
Action creator runs code to make an API request
(using axios for example)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 175px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 495px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

div.font:
Action creator returns an 'action' with the fetched data on the 'payload' property
(Remember, action creators are wrapped within the `dispatch` function when we wire them using `connect`).

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 477px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div:
Some reducer sees the action, returns the data off the 'payload'
(this modifies the redux store)

switch.text:
Some reducer sees the action, returns the data off the 'payload'
(this modifies the redux store)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 495px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div: Because we generated some new state object, redux/react-redux cause our React app to be rerendered

switch.text: Because we generated some new state object, redux/react-redux cause our React app to be rerendered

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 275px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div: Components are generally responsible for fetching data they need by calling an action creator

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 275px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div: Action creators are responsible for making API requests

switch.text: Action creators are responsible for making API requests

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 275px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
div.div: We get fetched data into a component by generating new state in our redux store, then getting that into our component through mapStateToProps

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 17px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 208px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal; text-align: center;

div.i: This is where Redux-Thunk comes into play

switch.text: This is where Redux-Thunk comes into play
